org.fluidity.composition.container

Interface DependencyInjector


  • public interface DependencyInjector
    Performs dependency injection. This is an internal interface to be used by dependency injection container implementations.

    Usage

     final ContainerServices services = …;
 final DependencyInjector injector = services.dependencyInjector();
 …
 final Constructor<MyComponent> injector.findConstructor(MyComponent.class);

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  DependencyInjector.Resolution
      Callback methods to resolve the various types of special and regular dependencies.

    • Method Detail

      • constructor

        DependencyGraph.Node constructor(Class<?> api,
                                 DependencyGraph.Traversal traversal,
                                 DependencyResolver container,
                                 ContextNode contexts,
                                 ContextDefinition context,
                                 Constructor<?> constructor)
        Resolves all parameters of the given constructor and returns a dependency graph node representing the component instance that would be produced by that constructor. The returned node's DependencyGraph.Node.instance() method will instantiate the component and also inject its @Inject annotated fields.
        Parameters:
        api - the component interface of the component to construct.
        traversal - the current graph traversal.
        container - the container to resolve dependencies of the component.
        contexts - context node corresponding to the constructor's owning component.
        context - the current context definition.
        constructor - the constructor to resolve the arguments of.
        Returns:
        a dependency graph node.

      • fields

        <T> T fields(T instance,
             DependencyGraph.Traversal traversal,
             DependencyResolver container,
             ContextNode contexts,
             ContextDefinition context)
        Injects all @Inject annotated fields of the received component. Useful for components instantiated by means other than calling DependencyInjector.constructor().
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the given instance to inject the fields of.
        Parameters:
        instance - the object to inject the fields of.
        traversal - the current graph traversal.
        container - the container to resolve dependencies of the component.
        contexts - context node corresponding to the component.
        context - the current context definition.
        Returns:
        the received component.

      • invoke

        Object invoke(Object component,
              Method method,
              Object[] arguments,
              DependencyGraph.Traversal traversal,
              DependencyResolver container,
              ContextNode contexts,
              ContextDefinition context,
              boolean explicit)
       throws ComponentContainer.ResolutionException,
              Exceptions.Wrapper
        Injects the parameters of the given method that the provided argument list contains no value for, and invokes the method on the given component.
        Parameters:
        component - the object to call the method on.
        method - the method to invoke.
        arguments - the argument list containing parameters that need no dependency injection.
        traversal - the graph traversal to use.
        container - the container to resolve method parameters.
        contexts - context node corresponding to the component.
        context - the current context definition.
        explicit - tells whether all method arguments are subject to injection (true) or only those annotated with @Inject.
        Returns:
        the received instance.
        Throws:
        ComponentContainer.ResolutionException - thrown when the search yields no or multiple constructors.
        Exceptions.Wrapper - when the method throws an exception.

      • findConstructor

        Constructor<?> findConstructor(Class<?> componentClass)
                        throws ComponentContainer.ResolutionException
        Find the injectable constructor of the given class.

        There is no check for any constructor parameter being satisfiable. Synthetic constructors are ignored. If there is any constructor annotated with @Inject, that one is returned. If there's only one constructor, it is returned. If there is a default constructor and another, and neither is annotated with @Inject, the other one is returned. If these checks do not yield a single constructor, the same checks are made on public constructors only. If that yields no or multiple constructors, a ComponentContainer.ResolutionException is thrown.

        For synthetic constructors see the Java Language Specification: The Form of a Binary and search for the term synthetic.

        Parameters:
        componentClass - the component class to find the injectable constructor of.
        Returns:
        the injectable constructor of the given class.
        Throws:
        ComponentContainer.ResolutionException - thrown when the search yields no or multiple constructors.

      • resolve

        DependencyGraph.Node resolve(Class<?> api,
                             AccessGuard<ComponentContainer> guard,
                             DependencyInjector.Resolution resolution)
        Handles the various special and regular dependency types by invokes the appropriate method of the provided resolution object based on the type of the given dependency. A dependency to a ComponentContainer will be restricted, meaning that it will only resolve components and component groups after it has been enabled.
        Parameters:
        api - the dependency type.
        guard - the object to guard against access from constructors to dependency injected containers; never null and can be created by containerGuard().
        resolution - resolves the various dependency types.
        Returns:
        a resolved node or null if the given dependency could not be resolved.

      • containerGuard

        AccessGuard<ComponentContainer> containerGuard()
        Creates an object that guards against access to a container. Used to create the guard parameter of resolve(Class, AccessGuard, DependencyInjector.Resolution).
        Returns:
        an object that guards against access to a container.
